detaileddescription.para: contains all the definitions of time_axis including the combine algorithms.
definition: time-axis is an ordered sequence of non-overlapping periods
notice: a) the most usual time-axis is the fixed_dt time-axis in the SHyFT core, this is the one we use(could even need a highspeed-nocompromise version)

b) continuous/dense time-axis: there are no holes in total_period types: fixed_dt, calendar_dt, point_dt c) sparse time-axis: there are holes within the span of total_period types: period_list and calendar_dt_p
